Hi, I'm Ashaab Khan

qwe

About Me

I am currently a 4th year computer science student concentrating in Big Data, set to graduate in April 2021. Having built up a strong foundation in programmable logic and data structures, I specialize in Automation, Predictive Analytics and Full Stack development. I love the combination of creativity and problem solving skills used when writing code and I'm always looking forward to learn more.

In addition to my education, my past work work experience has provided me with the opportunity to build many strengths. I'm a natural leader with strong analytical skills which I use to make sound decisions. A positive environment with an emphasis on passion and collaboration is one in which I thrive.

Education

Bachelors of Computer Science - Big Data Concentration

Wilfrid Laurier University
September 2016 - April 2021

3.4 GPA

TA for CP320: Digital Electronics

Experience

Parker Hannifin - Software Developer Intern
May 2019 - Present

Created and maintained various web applications for internal usage that supports supply chain, marketing and business analytics departments using ASP.NET, C# and SQL.

Supported the IT helpdesk by resolving technical end user equipment or related user technical issues.

Developed a C# program that automatically creates a commercial invoice for all international exports when scanning an export shipment slip; removed manual task for warehouse staff and improved productivity.

Built a hardware system that measures and weighs incoming products for storage using a 3-dimensional scale and created software to calculate optimal solutions for storing maximum number of products in storage areas.

Analyzed department effectiveness by extracting performance metrics from a SQL database and visualizing results using Power BI and created bi-weekly reports to present for the team.

Outlined and corrected points of inefficiency related to supply chain during quarterly Kaizen events, by designing processes to automate manual tasks and remove any inefficiencies and waste.

Amazon - IT Support Technician
May 2018 - September 2018

Maintained and troubleshot IT equipment, such as PCs, wireless handheld devices and other end user devices, resolved technical issues identified by employees.

Created Macros on Microsoft Excel using VBA that automated order tracking and shipment delivery processes, increasing productivity and efficient use of time.

Set up android driver devices/servers, installed or upgraded operating systems when required.

Maintained IT inventory, performed inventory checks of assets within the IT department.


Skills

Languages: Python, Java, C, C#, SQL, VBA, HTML, CSS, JQuery

Software: AWS, Git, Visual Studio, Telerik Controls

Projects

Movie Recommendation System

Console application that makes rating predictions and recommends movies to the user by implementing a SVD and collaborative filtering algorithm to find latent vectors from a 100k MovieLens database, from which the model uses to make the predictions and recommendations; implemented using Python, Pandas API and SciKit-Learn API.

PinMe

Web application where users can “pin” points of interests given their current location within the Wilfrid Laurier campus. Creates a heat map of the most active common areas and information about the POI such as study hall availability, Tim Horton’s lineup length, etc.; implemented using Django and Python and MySQL.
